my:Details.my:Title: Refilling of Self Contained Breathing Apparatus Cylinders

my:Hazard.my:ControlMeasures: a) Use of suitable and appropriate PPE: overall, safety shoes, hard hat with chin strap, gloves, safety goggles, etc.; b) Personnel not assigned to compressor related tasks must stand away from the compressor at least 10 feet (3 metres); c) Operator must be very careful not to get parts of their clothing tangled up in the compressor moving parts; d) Do not wear chains, bracelets or rings when operating the unit; e) Do NOT stick hands, screwdrivers or other tools in any moving parts; f) The working area must have proper lighting to ensure good operation; g) Always respect the instructions, WARNINGS and rules from the Manufacturer's Manual.

a) Use of suitable and appropriate PPE: overall, safety shoes, hard hat with chin strap, gloves, etc.; b) The exhaust area is a hot area. Use proper protection while operating the unit, since there is DANGER of physical damage (burning). c) Wait about 30 minutes after stopping the unit to perform any maintenance on it; d) Handle the cylinders using proper PPE, since there is any DANGER of physical damage (burns).

a) Only use NON polluted air; b) Use the compressor only in clean environments ambient (open area) where there are no dust particles or exhaust fumes; c) Be certain NOT to use the compressor where there is danger of an explosion, in corrosive environments or fire hazard area. d) Smoking is NOT permitted in the vicinity of the compressor during operation; e) before filling the tanks, make sure that the colour of the condensate mixture. This emulsion is white with a milky consistence. Some brown traces are also acceptable. In the event of getting a dense DARK BROWN emulsion, proceed to service the compressor immediately. f) Check the Charcoal filter cartridge and the intake filter and make sure that they are in good condition. Replace the filters as per Manufacturer's Manual chapter 6.6 and 6.8.

a) Use of suitable and appropriate PPE: overall, safety shoes, hard hat with chin strap, gloves, etc.; b) Consult the Manufacturer's Manual before commencing any maintenance work on the air Compressor; c) Do NOT use flammable liquids in the cleaning process of the compressor.
Use of suitable and appropriate PPE: overall, safety shoes, hard hat with chin strap, gloves, EAR DEFENDERS, etc.;

my:Main.my:Footer: Risk Assessment: G 23 - Refilling of Self Contained Breathing Apparatus Cylinders
